data.title: Dharma Chakram (1996)
data.meta_description: The story is about a family in which mother and son together fight against father for the principles and human values. Srividhya, as a ditched wife, rises up her kid Rakesh (Venkatesh) with well behavior, manner and makes him a good lawyer to do justice to the fellow woman who are cheated brutally by their husbands. How Rakesh takes the revenge on his father for the injustice that he had done to his mother is the crux of the film.
data.text:
Second movie I wanted to see badly enough that I just paid somebody to translate it.

Not quite as good as the last one, but still a lot of fun.

This movie, even for a Telugu film, has absolutely no chill but once you embrace that as a feature rather than a bug it's an excellent time.

It's mostly just Venkatesh alternately lawyering, kicking ass, and being upset, three things he does extremely well. He occasionally pauses to romance, which he also does well, but it makes up less of the movie than I'm used to for him.

The songs are excellent. Halfway through the movie I adde the album on Spotify.

All three women in it (Srividya, Ramya Krishnan,â€¦
